alert.note: Alert for Clarendon; Southeastern Orangeburg (South Carolina) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued April 30 at 1:04PM EDT by NWS Columbia
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of central Clarendon and southeastern Orangeburg Counties through 145 PM EDT... At 103 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from near Woods Bay State Park to near Bowman. Movement was northeast at 35 mph. ...Boaters on Lake Marion Should Seek Safe Harbor... HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Holly Hill, Santee Cooper Regional Airport, Eutawville, Vance, Eautaw Springs, Indian Bluff Recreation Park, Davis Station, Rocks Pond Campground and Marina, Blounts Landing, Mill Creek Marina and Campground and Foreston. This includes the following highways... Interstate 26 between mile markers 167 and 169. Interstate 95 between mile markers 85 and 91. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.
